intro: Cordyline erythrorachis, commonly known as the red-veined cordyline, is a striking ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It features tall, slender stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive red midrib and green margins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters during the summer months, adding an additional ornamental element. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for both outdoor gardens and indoor cultivation. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for landscaping and as a potted plant.
